DOC.brief_summary: The overall objective study compare clinical benefit safety two different surgical technique primary reverse total shoulder arthroplasty treatment shoulder pseudoparalysis chronic rotator cuff disease associate teres minor dysfunction . The first surgical technique include concomitant latissimus teres major transfer ( transfer group ) second technique include concomitant latissimus teres major transfer ( control group ) .
DOC.brief_title: Reverse Shoulder Arthroplasty With Without Concomitant Latissimus Teres Major Transfer Shoulder Pseudoparalysis With Teres Minor Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Shoulder pseudoparalysis due chronic rotator cuff dysfunction without glenohumeral arthritis . Chronic rotator cuff tear severe retraction , atrophy , fatty infiltration . Active forward elevation le 90 degree Teres minor dysfunction Positive lag hornblower sign Grade 2 great fatty infiltration teres minor infraspinatous see MRI Able attend schedule office visit Meet criterion latissimus teres major transfer Revision arthroplasty Previous shoulder infection Neuromuscular disorder ( ie : Parkinson 's ) Advanced dementia
